intro: Sulcorebutia roberto-vasquezii, commonly known as the Roberto Vásquez succulent, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape with short, cylindrical stems. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically during the cooler months. It has a slow growth rate and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
